intro: Justicia ocymoides, commonly known as the slender flamebeard, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often reaching heights of 30 to 100 centimeters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine hairs, while the stems are hairy and branched. Justicia ocymoides thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woods or along stream banks.
